jcmdline

Class Strings

  • java.lang.Object
    • jcmdline.Strings

  • public class Strings
extends Object
    A helper class used to obtain Strings for this package. Strings are retrieved from the ResourceBundle in "jcmdline.strings" which may be localized as necessary.
    Version:
    jcmdline Rel. @VERSION@ $Id: Strings.java,v 1.2 2002/12/07 14:22:06 lglawrence Exp $
    Author:
    Lynne Lawrence
    See Also:
    ResourceBundle

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Strings()

      Gets a String.

      Gets a String, filling in the supplied parameters.
      static String join(String separator, Object[] objs)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Strings

        public Strings()

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static String get(String key)
        Gets a String.
        Parameters:
        key - the key with which to look up the String in the ResourceBundle
        Returns:
        The String, associated with key. Should key not exist in the ResourceBundle a String consisting of the key is returned.
        See Also:
        ResourceBundle

      • get

        public static String get(String key,
                         Object[] params)
        Gets a String, filling in the supplied parameters.
        Parameters:
        key - the key with which to look up the String in the ResourceBundle
        params - parameters to be plugged into the String
        Returns:
        The String, associated with key, with the supplied params plugged in as described for java.text.MessageFormat. Should key not exist in the ResourceBundle a String containing the key and a list of the parameters is returned.
        See Also:
        MessageFormat, ResourceBundle

      • join

        public static String join(String separator,
                          Object[] objs)
        Join the toString() representations of the specified objects, separating them with the specified separator.
        Parameters:
        separator - the String to be inserted between the toString() representations of the Objects
        objs - the objects
        Returns:
        the resulting String
